edu.wpi.disco

Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.cetask.Shell
      • edu.wpi.disco.Console
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameConsole

    public class Console
extends Shell
    Interactive console for developing and debugging task models.

    Do not use this class for integrating Disco as a component into a larger system (see ComponentExample).

    Note: Disco is single threaded. However, to allow for running a debug console alongside a real-time Disco thread, processing of a console commands synchronized using the interaction object. and also Actor.respond(). See Interaction for thread-safe methods.

      • done

        public Task done(java.lang.String args)
        Report user execution of primitive task or achievement of non-primitive task. Task class and unspecified args default to current focus.

      • next

        public void next(java.lang.String respond)
        End user console turn. If there is a nested user, then it gets to respond next; otherwise it is agent's turn to respond. In automatic turn mode this command is not needed, since every turn is a single task; otherwise this is the command that signals the end of the user console turn.
        Parameters:
        respond - turn automatic turn mode on/off (default on)

      • execute

        public void execute(java.lang.String args)
        Like 'done', but first executes script associated with primitive task, if any. Convenient for running simulations.
        See Also:
        done(String)
